thread.title: David Sedaris, Mac Miller, Mersey Beatles and more shows in Louisville Oct. 21-27
thread.title_full: David Sedaris, Mac Miller, Mersey Beatles and more shows in Louisville Oct. 21-27

author: courier-journal.com
title: David Sedaris, Mac Miller, Mersey Beatles and more shows in Louisville Oct. 21-27
text:
1. Mac Miller is the bro-next-door rapper, a cute kid with more than a touch of Jerry Mathers as The Beaver. Don't be fooled. The guy has chops and is building an empire. With Goldlink, Domo and The Come Up.
WHEN: 8 p.m. Saturday
WHERE: Mercury Ballroom, 611 S. 4th St.
COST: $35
Rob Thomas (Photo: Provided)
2. Oh, Rob Thomas, why do you have to write such catchy songs? It should be easy to write you off as soccer-mom fodder, but your best songs get to the heart of pop music: ear candy, measured in pounds. Vinyl Station.
WHEN: 7:30 p.m. Tuesday
WHERE: Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St.
COST: $39.50, $69.50, $89.50
The Mersey Beatles (Photo: Provided)
3. The Mersey Beatles spent a decade as house tribute band at Liverpool's Cavern Club. For their first American tour, they've brought John Lennon's sister, Julia Baird, to sign copies of her books.
WHEN: 7 p.m. Sunday
WHERE: Bomhard Theater, The Kentucky Center
COST: $32, $39 and $59 (VIP)
Cold Fronts (Photo: Provided)
4. Cold Fronts is a project of Philadelphia's Craig Almquist, a power pop savant who makes it sound easy to toss three or four bold hooks into every song. Heyrocco and The Elwins open.
WHEN: 9 p.m. Sunday
WHERE: Zanzabar, 2100 S. Preston St.
COST: $8
David Sedaris (Photo: Provided)
Even David Sedaris fans would agree that the well has been running a bit dry. Comedy is hard, and comedic writing even more difficult, but America's reigning humorist still has much to offer.
WHEN: 7:30 p.m. Sunday
WHERE: Whitney Hall, The Kentucky Center
COST: $45, $55
